content.description: The Chatham Island robin is a small endangered bird found in scrub forests off the coast of New Zealand. The robin is preyed upon by introduced species such as cats and rats. In 1980, the population decreased to only <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> individuals and every individual today is a descendant of a single female.
content.question: Which of the following is best illustrated in the decline of the Chatham Island robins?

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain environmental concepts, processes, or models in applied contexts.
